[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: types] [Malicious checker injection] In BaselineConfiguration.checkers Vec, can an attacker inject custom CheckerConfig variants that execute arbitrary code or bypass security validations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: types] [Provider config manipulation] Can an attacker modify provider_configs in BaselineConfiguration to point Providers at malicious endpoints, stealing node credentials or metrics data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: types] [Runner config exploitation] Can an attacker manipulate runner_config parameters (num_retries, retry_delay) to cause resource exhaustion or timing attacks against target nodes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: types] [serde deny_unknown_fields bypass] Does the #[serde(deny_unknown_fields)] attribute on BaselineConfiguration properly reject unknown fields, or can attackers inject extra data that gets processed unsafely? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: types] [Configuration name XSS] Can configuration_name contain HTML/JavaScript that gets rendered unsafely in the NHC frontend, enabling cross-site scripting attacks against users? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: validate] [Validation bypass] In validate(), after calling validate_configuration(), are there any code paths where invalid configurations can still be used if build_checkers() fails silently? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: validate] [Partial validation] Does validate_configuration() check all security-critical fields in BaselineConfiguration, or can an attacker provide partially valid configs that bypass some security checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: validate] [Build_checkers error handling] In build_checkers(), if one CheckerConfig fails to build, does validation fail atomically, or can some checkers be silently skipped leaving security gaps? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: validate] [Async validation race] Can the async validate() function be called concurrently with the same configuration file, leading to race conditions in file access or validation state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: validate] [Debug logging exposure] Does the debug! macro in validate() expose sensitive configuration details (keys, URLs, credentials) in logs that could be accessed by unauthorized parties? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Integration] [Module loading order] Can an attacker exploit the order in which mod declarations are processed to cause use-after-free or uninitialized data access in imported modules? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Integration] [Public API exposure] Are read_configuration_from_file() and NodeAddress properly scoped with pub use, or can attackers access internal functions through module re-exports? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Integration] [Circular dependency] Can malicious configurations create circular references between node_address, types, and checkers that cause stack overflow during initialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Integration] [Type confusion] When passing BaselineConfiguration between modules, can type confusion occur if different modules expect different versions of the struct? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Checkers] [Checker type injection] Can an attacker specify unsupported Checker types in the configuration that get deserialized into unexpected variants, bypassing security validations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Checkers] [Consensus checker manipulation] If ConsensusProposalsChecker or ConsensusRoundChecker configs are manipulated, can an attacker cause false positives/negatives that hide consensus attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Checkers] [Handshake checker bypass] Can an attacker configure HandshakeChecker with weak parameters or disabled checks to allow unauthorized nodes to pass validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Checkers] [Hardware checker falsification] Can malicious HardwareChecker configurations report false hardware capabilities, allowing underpowered nodes to join as validators? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Checkers] [TPS checker gaming] Can an attacker configure TpsChecker with parameters that allow nodes to falsify transaction throughput metrics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Checkers] [Transaction correctness bypass] Can TransactionCorrectnessChecker be configured to skip critical validation steps, allowing nodes with incorrect transaction processing to pass? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Checkers] [State sync version downgrade] Can StateSyncVersionChecker be manipulated to accept outdated node versions with known vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Checkers] [Minimum peers threshold] Can MinimumPeersChecker thresholds be set to zero or negative values, disabling peer connectivity validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Checkers] [Latency threshold manipulation] Can LatencyChecker be configured with unrealistically high thresholds that allow slow nodes to pass, degrading network performance? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Checkers] [Required flag bypass] Can the required field in CommonCheckerConfig be manipulated so critical security checkers become optional? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Providers] [API index provider redirect] Can ApiIndexProviderConfig be configured to point at a malicious API server that returns falsified blockchain data? (Critical)
